I don't think it matters what is wanted - instead, we should consult people familiar with HDFS to discuss the proposed behavior. It is also makes sense to do it after removing a DN from a host, then we should add that as well.

I understand that this code is for 2.7 and adding a whole generic mechanism might be too hard. However, I think that we can do a "light" version of it where we put in `metainfo.xml` what needs to be done when certain actions are performed.

@jonathan-hurley / @zeroflag : A generic mechanism would actually look similar, a command that runs on a Master when a Salve host is deleted. The stack script implements whatever is needed in this case call a refresh. I haven't completely reviewed the patch yet but is that something which can be achieved without changing too many things?
@AaronWjf: Has this been tested in a secure env? We used to do this a while ago and dropped it a few releases later. @avijayanhwx: might recollect why we did it. I will try to find the Jira if not.
retest this please

@swagle, sounds doable. If a slave was deleted then ambari can send a SLAVE_DELETED command or something like that to the master and the master can do whatever it's needed. However this week I'm off so I can only do this next week.

I was not able to build the same ambari-metrics-**.rpm as hortonworks do successfully with the command 

mvn -B clean install package rpm:rpm  -DnewVersion=2.6.1.0.0  -Dpython.ver="python >= 2.6" -DskipTests -Drat.skip=true -DforkCount=4 -fae

looks like what I build was much different rpm and after installation, I find all the ambari-meterics and widgets are empty.
anyone know what was the problem? or you guys build the ambari-metrics-**.rpm seperately? or with another different build command? let me know?
